trans-unit.source: Represents a subitem of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control displays a list of items that are defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> class.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> can store subitem objects that are defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> class.
Subitems are displayed when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.View.Details>.
Typically, subitems contain information that is related to their parent item.
For example, if a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control displays items that represent orders, each item could display the order number.
Subitems could be added to each item to display information such as the product ordered, the quantity of items ordered, and the total price of the items ordered.

Unlike <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> objects, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects cannot be edited directly by the user (the user can edit <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> objects if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.LabelEdit%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control is set to `true`).

Because subitems cannot be directly edited by the user and do not display images, properties are limited to those that affect the style of the subitem text when it is displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.UseItemStyleForSubItems%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that contains the subitems is set to `false`, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Font%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.BackColor%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.ForeColor%2A> properties to change the styles applied to the text display.

Typically, the styles of the item and the subitems are the same in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control, but if you want to change the style of a specific <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> to highlight it, you can use these properties on the items you want to display differently.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> class with default values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> class with the specified owner and text.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> that represents the item that owns the subitem.
The text to display for the subitem.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> class with the specified owner, text, foreground color, background color, and font values.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> that represents the item that owns the subitem.
The text to display for the subitem.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the foreground color of the subitem.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the subitem.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that represents the font to display the subitem's text in.
Gets or sets the background color of the subitem's text.
You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.BackColor%2A> property to change the color displayed behind the subitem text.

This property can be used if you want to use different background and foreground color combinations (using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.ForeColor%2A> property to set the foreground color) to differentiate one subitem from another.
For example, you could set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.BackColor%2A> property to <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Red%2A> to identify subitems that display a negative value.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.UseItemStyleForSubItems%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> that owns the subitem is set to `true`, setting this property has no effect.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the subitem's text.
Gets the bounding rectangle of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> has not been added to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> or the owning <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> has not been added to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Bounds%2A> property returns an empty <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>.
The bounding <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref>.
Gets or sets the font of the text displayed by the subitem.
You can use this property to change the font styles applied to the text of the subitem.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.UseItemStyleForSubItems%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> is set to `true`, changing this property will have no effect.

Because the <xref:System.Drawing.Font> is immutable (meaning that you cannot adjust any of its properties), you can only assign the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Font%2A> property a new <xref:System.Drawing.Font>.
However, you can base the new font on the existing font.
The following is an example of how to adjust the existing font to make it bold:

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.UseItemStyleForSubItems%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> that owns the subitem is set to `true`, setting this property has no effect.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to the text displayed by the control.
Gets or sets the foreground color of the subitem's text.
You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.ForeColor%2A> property to change the color of the subitem text.

This property can be used if you want to use different background and foreground color combinations (using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.BackColor%2A> property to set the background color) to differentiate one item from another.

For example, you could set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.ForeColor%2A> property to <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Red%2A> to identify items that have a negative number associated with them.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.UseItemStyleForSubItems%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> that owns the subitem is set to `true`, setting this property has no effect.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the foreground color of the subitem's text.
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref>, or an empty string ("") if a name has not been set.
Resets the styles applied to the subitem to the default font and colors.
You can use this method to reset the font, background color, and foreground color settings applied to the subitem.
When the styles are reset, the subitem is displayed using the default font, background color, and foreground color settings.
Gets or sets an object that contains data about the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Tag%2A> property allows you to store additional information for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem>.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains data about the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the text of the subitem.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Text%2A> property allows you to determine the text displayed for the subitem.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.BackColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.ForeColor%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Font%2A> properties to specify how the text is displayed.
The text to display for the subitem.
Returns a string that represents the current object.
A string that represents the current object.
